text: Jérôme Vanier (born 2 November 1957) is a former professional tennis player from France. ==Biography== A left-handed player from Paris, Vanier played collegiate tennis in the United States, first at the University of Dallas, then in the early 1980s for Southern Methodist University. As a professional player, one of his best performances came in the first round of the 1983 US Open, where he had a straight sets wins over world number 26 Robert Van't Hof. Since 1994 he has been the Director of the Tennis Club de Lyon.
